text: religion plays a part in countless lives
but three-quarters of the world's
population lives in countries where
religion is highly restricted that's
according to a new report by the Pew
Research Center which also found
hostilities towards religion have
reached a six-year high you've got
places where the government restricts
religion Egypt being where this happens
the most and then you've got countries
where the society itself is hostile to
certain religions Pakistan leads on this
front the UK France and Mexico are
ranked lower for government restrictions
but higher when it comes to social
hostility note that North Korea was not
included infused study because of a lack
of data so what's happening in to whom
Christians and Muslims are harassed in
the most number of countries while
Buddhists are harassed in the least
number of countries in Jews will they
face more social harassment than they
face actual government restrictions
views research found that religious
minorities are often targets of abuse
whether they're Muslims in Buddhist
majority Sri Lanka or Coptic Christians
in Muslim majority Egypt and by looking
at the percentage of countries where
this happens there's clearly a growing
trend
women and what they wear are also a
religious flashpoint one-third of
countries saw women harassed over
religious dress a big jump from just a
few years ago when it comes to the
overall rise in religious hostilities
the sharpest increases took place in the
Middle East and North Africa and the
country with a population over 500,000
showing the least hostility that would
be Cape Verde David vaati BBC News
Washington
